hr.fer.oop.lab3

Class Coach

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.oop.lab3.Person
      • hr.fer.oop.lab3.Coach
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Manager

    public class Coach
extends Person
implements Manager
    Class represents coach of a football team. It inherits Person and implements Manager so he knows how to manage team.
    Author:
    Jurij Kos

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void forceMyFormation()
      A manager uses his formation to set team's formation.
      int getCoachingSkill()
      Returning skill of a coach
      Formation getFavoriteFormation() 
      ManageableTeam getManagingTeam()
      getter for managing team
      void pickStartingEleven()
      A method used to pick the starting eleven from a team he manages (NOTE: only the players from registered players collection are eligible); a method must be careful to pick such players who can form a team formation (e.g., a number of forwards within first eleven should match a number of forwards in a team formation).
      void setCoachingSkill(int coachingSkill)
      Set value of a coach.
      void setFavoriteFormation(Formation favoriteFormation)
      If parameter favoriteFormation is not one of possible method doesn t make any changes.
      void setManagingTeam(ManageableTeam managingTeam)
      With this method, a manager sets a team he manages if a team is not null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Coach

        public Coach(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String country,
             int emotion,
             int coachingSkill,
             Formation favoriteFormation)
        Constructor for creating object with wanted values.
        Parameters:
        emotion - It must be from 0-100 or it will be set to 50 automatically.
        coachingSkill - It must be from 0-100 or it will be set to 50 automatically.
        favoriteFormation - Chose one of the following 5-4-1 4-4-2 and 3-5-2 or it will be 4-4-2

      • Coach

        public Coach()
        This constructors put variables of object to default values. Default values are 50 for emotion and coaching skill 4-4-2 for formation, Noland for country and Jon Doe for name. Name and country couldnt be changed after you created object.

    • Method Detail

      • getCoachingSkill

        public int getCoachingSkill()
        Returning skill of a coach
        Returns:
        skill Int in range 0-100. Better player has higher skill.

      • setCoachingSkill

        public void setCoachingSkill(int coachingSkill)
        Set value of a coach. If you send impossible value function doesn t make any changes.
        Parameters:
        coachingSkill - 0-100 Bigger value means better coach.

      • getFavoriteFormation

        public Formation getFavoriteFormation()
        Returns:
        Coach s favorite formation.

      • setFavoriteFormation

        public void setFavoriteFormation(Formation favoriteFormation)
        If parameter favoriteFormation is not one of possible method doesn t make any changes.
        Parameters:
        favoriteFormation - Possible formations are F352 F541 and F442

      • getManagingTeam

        public ManageableTeam getManagingTeam()
        getter for managing team

      • setManagingTeam

        public void setManagingTeam(ManageableTeam managingTeam)
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        With this method, a manager sets a team he manages if a team is not null.
        Specified by:
        setManagingTeam in interface Manager
        Parameters:
        managingTeam - team

      • pickStartingEleven

        public void pickStartingEleven()
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        A method used to pick the starting eleven from a team he manages (NOTE: only the players from registered players collection are eligible); a method must be careful to pick such players who can form a team formation (e.g., a number of forwards within first eleven should match a number of forwards in a team formation).
        Specified by:
        pickStartingEleven in interface Manager

      • forceMyFormation

        public void forceMyFormation()
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        A manager uses his formation to set team's formation.
        Specified by:
        forceMyFormation in interface Manager
